result.execSummary:
The defendant Bruce Allen Colburn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 to be paid to COCC within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be warrant.
Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.

Must undergo COMPAS evaluation and follow through with criminogenic needs as recommended by Probation.
Treatment as required by Probation Agent.
Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bruce Allen Colburn

14CF118-Count 2-  14CF233-Count 1-
